page.title: 03Work and Employment (cont)
page.content: A local garage has closed its petrol pumps whilst the other has diversified its business, supplying liquified gas for domestic and agricultural use. The reduced volume of traffic has reinforced the trend deriving from increased mobility and changing retail patterns and led to the further decline in the number of local shops. Two have closed cince 1981, and where once there were 22, there are now five. There is also a part-time branch of the Bank of Scotland. If work opportunities have declined in the service sector, ranch style farming has reinforced the diminuition in employment in agriculture.
